meanings.definition: To move with short, unsteady steps
meanings.sent1: The little puppy toddled around the yard, trying to keep its balance.
meanings.sent2: The elderly man toddled slowly across the room, holding onto his cane.
meanings.sent3: The toddler toddled towards the toy, wobbling like a tiny penguin.
meanings.sent4: The ducklings toddled after their mother, mimicking her every move.
meanings.sent5: The baby elephant toddled clumsily, its big feet causing it to stumble.

meanings.definition: To walk unsteadily, as a young child
meanings.sent1: The little girl toddled towards her mother, her chubby legs wobbling.
meanings.sent2: The toddler toddled happily in the park, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent3: The baby toddled around the house, giggling at every step.
meanings.sent4: The young boy toddled on the sandy beach, leaving tiny footprints behind.
meanings.sent5: The twins toddled together, holding hands for support.

meanings.definition: To move in a leisurely or relaxed manner
meanings.sent1: The cat toddled lazily across the sunlit porch, enjoying the warmth.
meanings.sent2: The elderly couple toddled hand in hand along the peaceful path.
meanings.sent3: The old dog toddled slowly towards its favorite spot by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: The turtle toddled along the sandy shore, taking its time to reach the water.
meanings.sent5: The bear cub toddled through the forest, exploring the new surroundings.
